query:
Write a Related Works section for an academic paper given the paper's abstract. Here is the paper abstract:
Multimodal protein language models deliver strong performance on mutation-effect prediction, but training such models from scratch demands substantial computational resources. In this paper, we propose a fine-tuning framework called InstructPLM-mu and try to answer a question: \textit{Can multimodal fine-tuning of a pretrained, sequence-only protein language model match the performance of models trained end-to-end? } Surprisingly, our experiments show that fine-tuning ESM2 with structural inputs can reach performance comparable to ESM3. To understand how this is achieved, we systematically compare three different feature-fusion designs and fine-tuning recipes. Our results reveal that both the fusion method and the tuning strategy strongly affect final accuracy, indicating that the fine-tuning process is not trivial. We hope this work offers practical guidance for injecting structure into pretrained protein language models and motivates further research on better fusion mechanisms and fine-tuning protocols.

nuggets.text: Multimodal protein models excel in mutation-effect prediction
Training from scratch requires substantial computational resources
InstructPLM-mu fine-tunes pretrained sequence-only protein models
Fine-tuning ESM2 with structural inputs matches ESM3 performance
Feature-fusion designs and fine-tuning recipes are crucial
Fusion method and tuning strategy affect final accuracy
Deep learning models predict mutation effects from sequence data
Structure-aware methods improve accuracy by incorporating structural information
VenusREM and S3F leverage multimodal information for performance
Feature Fusion and Training Paradigm critical for model performance
Multimodal fusion strategies underexplored in protein language models
Protein structural features facilitate fine-grained integration
End-to-end training optimizes all parameters in a single phase
Sequence-structure alignment strategies adapted for protein modeling
Accurate mutation prediction requires sequence and structural integration
Fine-tuning process is not trivial
Guidance for injecting structure into pretrained protein models
Research on fusion mechanisms and fine-tuning protocols needed
Protein mutation prediction central to understanding protein function
ProteinGym benchmarks pre-trained PLMs in protein modeling
AIDO.Protein highlights PLMs' potential in protein modeling tasks
Multimodal alignment enhances cross-modal understanding
DeepStack enhances multimodal performance with vision features
Multi-stage training improves efficiency and final performance
Unified pretraining integrates multimodal inputs
